title: Palmer Penguins Visualization Post
text: For this visualization using Palmer Penguins data set, I decided to create a scatterplot of the penguins’ Culmen Length vs. Culmen Depth. For an added layer of texture, I wanted to separate them by species to get a more distinct correlation.

title: Palmer Penguins Visualization Post
text: For this visualization using Palmer Penguins data set, I decided to create a scatterplot of the penguins’ Culmen Length vs. Culmen Depth. For an added layer of texture, I wanted to separate them by species to get a more distinct correlation.

title: Palmer Penguins Visualization Post
text:
Importing
I started by importing the data set and reading it into the penguins dataframe.

import pandas as pd
url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pic16b-ucla/24W/main/datasets/palmer_penguins.csv"
penguins = pd.read_csv(url)

title: Palmer Penguins Visualization Post
text:
Data Cleaning
Next is to clean the data by getting rid of all non number values and shortening the species’ names.

# Replacing species names with only their first word
penguins["Species"] = penguins["Species"].str.split().str.get(0) 

# Dropping any NaN values in the relevant columns to our visualization
penguins.dropna(subset=["Culmen Length (mm)"], inplace=True)
penguins.dropna(subset=["Culmen Depth (mm)"], inplace=True)

title: Palmer Penguins Visualization Post
text:
Plotting Visualization
I used Seaborn to plot my visualization. Inputting Culmen Length on the x-axis, Culmen Depth on the y-axis, and Species as the legend indicators.

import seaborn as sns

# Create scatterplot using seaborn relpot
plt = sns.relplot(data=penguins, x="Culmen Length (mm)", y="Culmen Depth (mm)", hue="Species")

# Set title and axis labels
plt.fig.suptitle("Culmen Depth vs. Length by Species")
plt.set_axis_labels("Culmen Length (mm)", "Culmen Depth (mm)")
